Health & Safety for Licensed Child Care Providers, Module A
Section 1: Prevention & Control of Infectious Disease, Including Immunizations

Exception for Children Experiencing Homelessness

Below are some measures that you, as a child care provider, should take when faced with a communicable disease at your site.

New section of LARA Rule R400.8143

Licensing Rule R400.8143 discusses Child Care Center requirements for Childrenâ€™s Records. A section of it discusses requirements for up-to-date immunizations.

McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvement Act of 2001

This is a part of the McKinney-Vento Homeless Education Assistance Improvement Act of 2001.

Not cited if unable to produce Health & Immunization Records

Once a communicable disease has been identified in your site, you have an obligation to contact all the parents of children at your site.  You should share with them the name of the disease, signs & symptoms to look out for, and recommended prevention measures from the Centers for Disease Control (CDC).CDC Disease Conditions (Center Rule R00.8155)

Refer child to local education agency liaison for Homeless Children and Youth

They are required to refer children experiencing homelessness that require extra assistance to the local education agency liaison for Homeless Children and Youth.
